results.title: The Genie from downunder. - Vol. 6.
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Jeremy Swan, Patricia Edgar, Phil Jones and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: In “Triple treat”, confusion reigns supreme when Conrad and Otto make two replica’s of Penelope’s magic opal. There’s lots of opal rubbing but little magic as a result! Bruce finally gets the opal back to the cave in “It’s still magic” and is about to free himself when Penelope and Baz accuse him of selfishness. Eventually some sort of compromise is reached and Bruce finds out about the magic of romance.

results.title: Customer service
results.brief_description: The aim of this manual is to present knowledge and techniques required to develop and maintain on-going service to customers and to convert complaints into appointments to further strengthen customer ties. A video which complements this manual may be borrowed as a separate loan item.

results.title: Prostate disease
results.creator_credit: Diane Sundin, Peter Campbell, Merck, Sharp and Dohme and Special Broadcasting Services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “English at work”.
This program looks at the early symptoms of prostate problems, how many men react to these and what men need to do to prevent prostate cancer. An excellent progam to encourage men to have check ups at an early stage of problems. Partly dramatised.

results.title: Live & or let die
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Best of Lateline”.
This lateline program examines the issues surrounding the legalisation of euthanasia. The first portion of the program looks at the situation in Holland where euthanasia is decriminalised. The second portion of the program is a panel discussion between 3 doctors who present a range of opinions on this topic. The video includes Teacher’s Notes. No other credits available.

results.title: Muriel's wedding (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: P.J. Hogan, Jocelyn Moorhouse, Lynda House, Jill Bilcock, Film Victoria, House and Moorhouse Films and Peter Szabo and Associates
results.brief_description: Muriel is a dag, an Abba maniac and out of place girl who would give anything to be like her bitchy friends. In her hunt to find Mr. Right in all the wrong places, Muriel takes a one-way ticket to freedom to find herself. A bitter-sweet and much acclaimed film which touches the essence of the themes of self-respect, identity and friendship. Toni Collette gives an inspired performance as Muriel and the supporting cast includes Bill Hunter, Sophie Lee, Jeanie Drynan and Rachel Griffiths.
results.creator_credit_for_label: P.J. Hogan, Jocelyn Moorhouse, Lynda House, Jill Bilcock, Film Victoria, House and Moorhouse Films and Peter Szabo and Associates

results.title: The Adventures of Priscilla, queen of the desert. (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Stephan Elliott, Al Clark, Michael Hamlyn, Latent Image and Specific Films
results.brief_description: This incredibly successful Australian comedy traces the adventures of three Sydney drag-queens who travel through the Australian outback in order to perform their exuberant act in Alice Springs. On their journey through the desert, on a bus christened Priscilla, they encounter both friendship and enmity from the small bush communities. Guy Pearce is excellent as the youngest drag-queen who has a tough mouth but a lot to learn about the world while Hugo Weaving is moving as a man who must reveal the truth of his homosexuality to his son. Terence Stamp is unforgettable as the transsexual Bernice and the loving relationship that develops between Stamp and Bill Hunter’s outback “bloke” is very tender and very touching. Full of humour, colour and bizarre costumes for which the film won an Academy Award, “Priscilla” is a wickedly entrancing family movie which shows that not only Australian cities but the mythical Australian bush has been affected and changed by ethnic and sexual multiculturalism. The soundtrack is full of great drag disco classics from “I Will Survive” and “Go West” to the more recent “Finally” and “Save the Best for Last.”

results.title: The Crucifixion by Pablo Picasso, 1930
results.creator_credit: Marie de Mercey, Delta Image, La Sept and RMN
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Palettes”.
This program examines Picasso’s painting “The Crucifixion” painted in 1930. It was an unusual subject for the artist, given his indifference to religious themes, however evidence from his sketch books indicates that he was secretly drawn to this subject. The program analyses the painting in terms of its relationship to depictions of the Crucifixion over time, and in the context of the artist’s life and work. The troubled relationship he was experiencing with women, in particular his wife at that time is reflected in the figure of Christ.

results.title: The Haunted huntress. Night of the leopard
results.creator_credit: Amanda Barrett, Keith Scholey, Owen Newman, BBC and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of wildlife”.
Narrated by David Attenborough, “The Haunted huntress” looks at the changing fortunes of a cheetah mother and her cubs as they attempt to survive the harsh environment of Kenya’s Masai Mara. “Night of the leopard” reveals the amazing nocturnal world of a leopard mother and her cubs as she battles with lions, hyenas and crocodiles.

results.title: Sheep's back
results.creator_credit: Peter Butt, Susan Ardill and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Australia rode on the sheep’s back for over a century. Wool and the people who grew it became entwined with our national identity and the image of the sheep adorned postage stamps and coinage. The Country Party was a powerful force in Australian politics, however by the 1960’s it was Australia’s mineral deposits, particularly iron ore which began to dominate trade. As a consequence, rural Australians found themselves out of step with Australians living in our rapidly changing cities. This excellent documentary looks at the history of wool and examines what the future holds for those Australians who once rode upon the sheep’s back.

results.title: Charm school
results.brief_description: An animated films about two pompous ladies sitting down for a cup of tea and one boasts of her fortunes and properties while a crunch bird remarks “fantastic”. No other credits available. A comedy.
